title: 30th Anniversary GM Smoidi Light General Midi Competition
description:
The People’s Coalition of TANDY “GM General Midi, 30th Anniversary Warrior of the 30 SMoidi Light 30 ZRainbow Spectrume 2022" 300 Competition!

The annual celebration of General MIDI has borne fruit!

10 tracks,
10 remixes,
and 10 General Midi compatible files!

History time:
The competition takes place in the Spring every year because March 7th is the MID-POINT between Ikutaru Kakehashi 's (from Roland) and Dave Smith's (from Sequential Circuits) birthdays
This competition is meant to honor and spread appreciation
for their dedicated work, along with all of those at the Japan MIDI Standards Committee(JMSC) and the American MIDI Manufacturers Association(MMA) !

credits.contribution:
Congrats to our Grand Prize Winners of this year 's The People’s Coalition of TANDY “GM General Midi, 30th Anniversary Warrior of the 30 SMoidi Light 30 ZRainbow Spectrume 2022" 300 Competition!

And congratulations to all of our Category Award Winners :

Devotional Category Award Winner: RAMPTOE)(GENIUS IS KAT MAZUR

Vocal Performance Category Award Winner: Oratorical Orator

Experimental Category Award Winner: Joe Misterovich

Chamber Music Award Winner: raef

Excellence in Solo Composition Award Winner: Emiliano Cruz

Cinematic Award Winner: Opus Impetus

Watercolors Award Winner: Scuzz McGuzz

Audio Engineering Award Winner: 31i3

title: Tetso Cube Light Ride
description: We call ourselves tandy so people know who we are

title: Star Palm Tree
description:
"Let's get lost inside"

In August's twilight, secret bard Sam Walters emerges to lament our ancient founders, having written of what's now, what's then, and what's to come shakily but Shurely into a naked diary—bound by 7 years of dreams, boundless love and fear.

The disappearing ink sinks from page to page, wetting with wist and longing the parchment.

The soaked book dries from its extravagant, twisted shapes into warm, familiar cloth—every stage inscribed into the seams as harmonics in the soul of a bell. Neither method nor madness could stir the flutter of the heart like hummingbird wings in each character's tentative steps towards the beautiful, dreadful evening.

title: Another Day
description:
Secret bard Sam Walters has returned with his latest incantation from the upcoming album, Centre St.

In the face great peril, you must now choose your own destiny. Will you rise to the occasion? Will the sands of regret be deposited back into your broken hourglass, renewed as crystals of possibility? Or will the cold crescendo of time wash us back to familiar shores?

Only you can decide…

title: Centre St.
description: Sam Walters is a songwriter, recordist, nurse-in-training, and long time Coalition member based in Brooklyn, NY. Centre St was recorded with love and meticulous care over the course of 6 years and we are so happy that this deeply personal document of life is out in the world.

title: Tuesday's Universe
description: A virtual art gallery by Tuesday Hamilton, presented On-Line by a subset of the PCoTandy Web Division

title: Slow Gold
description:
✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼ ✼

"I'm loath to quit the task of helping Nick realize these settings, so a few words before our ship sails to soften the blow of its leaving: for months, a few miles upriver from Emily's town, I saw the poetry working on him. Oftentimes I would find him in his study without so much as a candle lit, a full moon casting its negative shadow over jumbles of papers and experiments, singing softly by the window. Had I not been there to guide him through the ruggedest part of the journey (bouts of melancholy, brain fever, fits, etc.), the project surely would have failed. We were fortunate enough to leave that outermost place with what seventeen minutes of material we found. What else can be said of Emily's poetry that hasn't yet? The quaintness belies its extremity - to be touched by it is to apprehend Eternity."

-Bugnu, October 2022
label: Blamscamp

credits.name: Amherst College Archives and Special Collections
Heather Jones @ So Big Auditory
credits.contribution: Mastering

title: Into the Blue
description: Soaring melodies and soothing tones, BLUE DISH’s sophomore album welcomes you Into the Blue. Drawing upon a vast array of influences — from Jazz to Blues (and even Classical) — BLUE DISH defies genre at every moment. Rather than rushing the album to meet a deadline, the duo took their time, finding the right melodies, the right chords, and the right Sound.
label: Apple Music

title: Tubis
description:
Tubis is an audio-visual meditation on Ohio’s clay-rich soil. A musical piece written for 5 tubas and electronics, the music was originally composed as part of an installation in composer Katarina Mazur’s backyard, and was presented via a wireless speaker hidden in a large rusty tube.

“Forgotten histories enshrined in a living sculptural environment of foraged objects and plant materials [...] When the corona virus struck, the installation was moved to my backyard, where I continued to meditate on its energies. The installation inspired awareness of the changing of seasons and topography of my little piece of land behind the Mickey Mart gas station and convenience store. The walnut saplings and cleavers hugged the objects. The grass grew greener. The crocuses sang their nightly song with the peepers. Tubis became a home to the sweet spirits of Spring and Summer.” – Katarina Mazur, Composer/Director
label: Bandcamp

title: In Here
description:
“Skilled hands make quick work”

[ 8-page comics zine ]

Dream-like miniature narratives celebrating the ineffable textures of the subconscious, the quiet power of friendship and the intangible gestures of the spirit! Leah Jacobson’s characters will muck-about and roll-around in vibrant two-color riso toner. Leah Jacobson makes comics, sews, referees soccer, and pursues her doctorate in sociology in Los Angeles, CA. PCOT0012
label: Bandcamp Store

title: Deep Blue
description:
Hand-designed, hand-assembled, hand-made, self-produced, the "Deep Blue Triple Album" includes a 16-page art booklet, the brand new 8-song album "Deep Blue", BLUE DISH's previous 2 releases "Out of the Blue" & "Into the Blue".

Hand-packaged in Recycled Jewel Cases and printed in a local print shop, this album is sure to soothe & satisfy. 

"Now that you've gotten acquainted, please make yourself comfortable in the Deep Blue. This is the world birthed from our ongoing lives & relationships as musicians & – more importantly – as friends."
– BLUE DISH, Deep Blue release memo '23

title: Tuesday-verse: Sorcerer Central
description: The Tuesday-verse: Sorcerer Central is a physio-digital painting installation. The physical paintings are on display at the Looky Here gallery in Greenfield MA. With syber-support from one of the P.C.o.T Web workgroups, the Tuesday-verse is also a beautiful website! And you can view and make offers on these beautiful (& large) paintings on-line!
label: Website

title: Chris Weisman - Time Machine (Kurt Rosenwinkel)
description:
Video Of Chris Weisman Covering An Unreleased Kurt Rosenwinkel Song

"I’m Chris Weisman. In 2008, I was interviewing Kurt Rosenwinkel for my blog, Camp Studio, and he sent me his recording (still unreleased as of May 2024) of his song “Time Machine.” From the moment I heard it preternaturally unspool, I knew—and this remains the case—“This is my favorite song.” Kurt is releasing his Ultimate Book of Compositions on his label, Heartcore Records. “Time Machine” is in there, along with 57 other unreleased songs, in the expansive digital materials that accompany the physical book. 💕 Here is my arrangement, featuring Inverted Tuning classical guitar and my beloved soprano Yamaha Venova." Video by Chris Weisman and elie mcafee-hahn. Brought to you by the People’s Coalition of Tandy. PCOT0019
label: Youtube
